entries.title: Perl language's popularity hits all-time low
entries.text: Infoworld trying to make another populistic assertion based on the biased, and incorrect TIOBE index, ran by the well known Perl-hater Paul Jansen. Unfortunately, other stats seem to show similar trends. The question: do you mind? And if you do: What do you do in order to change the trend?

entries.title: Why Companies Turn Me Down For Contracts
entries.text: The story telling capabilities of Ovid are clearly good. In this article he explains how searching for the next contract takes away time he could spend on writing open source code, and how you could help by getting your employer to hire him.

entries.title: Vim::X Update
entries.text: Yanick Champoux explains how preparing the Perl Weekly was made easier for him by adding special keys to Vim that will run a Perl script to fetch information from a web site and update the currently edited file.

entries.title: Dada Mail Seven Released! Rejoice!
entries.text: Dada Mail is a web-based mailing list manager, written in Perl.

entries.title: Learning the Perl Debugger: Lesson 2
entries.text: Chisel continues to show the built-in debugger of Perl. This time it is inspecting variables using p and x.

entries.title: Reading Code - Plack
entries.text: Eric Johnson started a series of articles explaining the implementation of Plack, the implementation of PSGI.

entries.title: Why did Extutils::ParseXS fail tests after building perl on Windows 8.1?
entries.text: Sinan Unur is fighting with the compilation of Perl on his brand new Windows machine. The solution is in linking with the 64-bit libraries.

chapters.title: Heartbleed
chapters.header: I guess you've already heard about the serius security bug found in OpenSSL. This is just a reminder and a few articles related to Perl sites

entries.title: Recovering from Heartbleed
entries.text: Mike Doherty (doherty) explains the recovery process and includes a link to perl script of Steffen Ullrich to check for the SSL Heartbleed vulnerability.

entries.title: Abandon Ship! It's Time to Ditch OpenSSL
entries.text: Timm Murray from the Wumpus Cave has a suggestion for you. Use NSS instead of OpenSSL.

entries.title: Maintaining the Perl 5 Core: Report for Month 6 (March 2014)
Speshial things
entries.text: The Perl 6 weekly reports a bunch of performance improvements in Rakudo.

entries.title: Can't locate inc/Module/Install.pm
entries.text: A special case of missing module error when you might try to install a module straight from its version control system.
